questions.question: I don’t let my children ……………………….. up late.
questions.description: Let is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: Try ……………………….. late.
questions.description: We make negative infinitives by putting not before the infinitive.

questions.question: I made him …………………………. me my money back.
questions.description: Make is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: She was heard …………………………. that she was quitting.
questions.description: The infinitive is used with to after passive forms of hear.

questions.question: I would like to lie down and ………………………….. to sleep.
questions.description: When we connect two infinitive structures with ‘and’, the second one is usually without to.

questions.question: Rather than ………………………… anymore, I decided to go home.
questions.description: Rather than is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: I have to feed the dogs as well as ……………………………. the plants.
questions.description: When we connect two infinitive structures with as well as, the second one is usually without to.

questions.question: She needn’t ............................................... any longer.
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You look tired. Why not ………………………… some rest?
questions.description: We can introduce suggestions with why not + infinitive without to.

questions.question: Do you want to leave now or …………………………… until they arrive?
questions.description: When we connect two infinitive structures with or, the second one is usually without to.

questions.question: I am ready to do anything but ……………………….
questions.description: When we connect two infinitive structures with but, the second one is usually without to.

questions.question: Do you feel the earth …………………………….?
questions.description: After feel + object, the infinitive is used without to.
